content:
23. ‘Thus saith the Lord of Hosts, the God of Israel, Amend 
your ways and your doings. Trust not in lying words 
saying: “The temple of the Lord, the temple of the Lord, 
the temple of the Lord”. This message was given by 
A. Amos    B. Micah C. Jeremiah 
D. Uzziah E. Ezekiel. 
 
24. Which prophet gave this cry? 
‘Woe is me! For I am lost, for I am a man of unclean lips, 
and I dwell in the midst of a people of unclean lips’. 
A. Hosea B. Jeremiah  
C. Isaiah D. Amos E. Haggai 
 
25. The prophet who proclaimed a new covenant of God 
with Israel and Judah was 
A. Ezekiei B. Jeremiah 
C. Hosea D. Micah E. Haggai. 
 
26. The synoptic gospels refer to the 
A. books of the New Testament 
B. first four books of the New Testament 
C. first three book of the New Testament 
D. first five books of the Bible 
E. Didache. 
 
27. ‘And he will go before him in the spirit and power of Elijah, 
to turn the hearts of the fathers to the children’. The person 
whose future work was being described here was 
A. Zachariah B. John the Baptist 
C. Paul D. Jesus Christ 
E. Joseph 
28. He said therefore to the multitudes ... ‘You brood of 
vipers! Who warned you to flee from the wrath to come?’ 
Who was the speaker? 
A. John the son of Zachariah. 
B. John the son of Zebedee 
C. John Mark 
D. Jesus Christ 
E. Simon Peter 
29. ‘You shall not tempt the Lord your God’ was said by 
Jesus to 
A. Peter after his confession 
B. the leper who asked to be cleansed 
C. Caiaphas at his trial 
D. the devil in the wilderness 
E. the sons of Zebedee who demanded the best 
seats in the kingdom. 
 
30. The people of Nazareth found it difficult to believe what 
Jesus preached to them because they 
A. were idolaters 
B. were stubborn 
C. knew him from childhood. 
D. had been scolded by him 
E. could not understand his doctrine. 
31. In the parable of the sower, the seeds on the goods 
ground are meant to represent those who 
A. accept and live by God’s word 
B. feed the poor 
C. have and love riches 
D. give alms in market places 
E. preach the words of God. 
 
32. Who is being referred to here? 
‘But he went out and began to talk freely about it, and 
to spread the news, so that Jesus could no longer 
openly enter a town, but was out in the country; and 
people came to him from every quarter. 
A. the Gerasene demoniac 
B. The leper from Galilee 
C. Jairus 
D. The blind man of Jericho 
E. The demoniac of Capernaum. 
 
33. ‘An evil and adulterous generation seeks for a sign, 
but no sign shall be given to it except the sign of Jonah,’ 
According to St. Mathew, Jesus said this to the 
A. disciple of John the Baptist 
B. multitude of people 
C. lawyers and the scribes 
D. Sadducees and the Zealots 
E. Pharisees and the Sadducees. 
 
34. And Jesus said to them, ‘Follow me and I will make you 
fishers of men. ‘This was addressed to 
A. Simon Peter and James 
B. James and John 
C. Simon Peter and John 
D. Andrew and James 
E. Simon Peter and Andrew. 
 
35. Hosanna means 
A. ride on in majesty B.ride on in glory 
C. ride on to die D.ride on to 
Calvary  E. save now. 
 
36. One of the reasons why Jesus denounced the Scribes 
and Pharisees was that they 
A. did not make many converts 
B. did not practice what they preached 
C. did not preach regularly in the temple 
D. took great care of the tombs of their ancestors 
E. often appeared in the market-place. 
 
37. Simon the Cananaean was 
A. the original name of Peter 
B. one of the twelve 
C. the Pharisee in whose house the woman 
anointedJesus  
D. the one who carried Jesus’ cross 
E. one of the brothers of Jesus. 
38. The reason why Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of 
James and Salome went to where Jesus was buried on 
the third day after the burial was to 
A. plead with the soldiers who were keeping 
watch there 
B. anoint the body of Jesus 
C. see if the body of Jesus was still there 
D. see if Jesus had risen from the dead 
E. weep at the tomb according to the custom of the 
Jews. 
39. To some who trusted in themselves that they were 
righteous and despised others, Jesus told the parable of 
the 
A. rich man and Lazarus 
B. Pharisee and the tax-collectors 
C. wise and foolish virgins 
D. prodigal son 
E. good Samaritan.
